go_data.justification: PD-L1 can be expressed by cancer cells and by infiltrating immune cells at the cell surface.
PD-L1 expression on tumor cells or immune cells contributes to T cell inhibition.
PD-L1 interacts with CMTM6 and CMTM4 as shown by co-immunoprecipitation.
CMTM6 protects PD-L1 from ubiquitination, suggesting that PD-L1 is a substrate for ubiquitin-protein transferase activity.
